title: Autonomy-enhancing program for online task-based mathematics learning

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Utilization of smartphone-based Web 2.0 tools, combining real-time interaction and asynchronous task completion.

learning_goals: Learners can complete subject-specific math assignments with over 80% self-directed learning using Web 2.0 tools (Padlet, Google Forms, etc.)
Learners can explain mathematical concepts through social interaction (chat/voice) via structured assignments (3 times) and open-ended assignments (2 times)
Learners can improve their ability to revise learning plans and write reflective journals by 70% based on teacher scaffolding (modeling and feedback)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
